home.name: Dale Lotts
home.ima: I'm an eXtreme Programming (XP) player-coach and Software Engineer
introduction: I'm available Corp-to-Corp contracts anywhere in the world, with travel up to 100%.
My rates are $150/hour + Travel and Expenses (T&E)

work experience.heading: Knight Rider Consulting, Inc.
work experience.subHeading: XP Coach and Full Stack Software Engineer
description: Elevate teams from 'Doing' Agile to 'Being' and 'Living' Agile.
Design and deliver community education presentations – e.g., Introduction to TDD, Introduction to Angular JS, Introduction to Meta Programming, Introduction to extreme programming, etc.

work experience.heading: Galvanize
description: Deliver boot camp style training to enterprise developers to apply Extreme Programming (XP).
Teach a class of 30 students more than 100 new technologies and techniques.
Help teams adopt XP practices through direct pairing while implementing features using a variety of technologies including NodeJS, and React.

Education.heading: University of Wisconsin - Eau Claire
Education.subHeading: Coursework toward a BS in Computer Science with an emphasis in Software Engineering.
description: Led a software engineering course team that developed software to aggregate partial election results for Wisconsin Public Radio. Reports from this software system are used by a political analyst and on-air-reporter to do analysis and prediction on election night.

cards.heading: Java
description: Java is the language which which I am most familiar. I used Java for 15 years Pearson VUE to build the test authoring and delivery applications.

cards.heading: JavaScript
description: I learned JavaScript and AngularJS at the same. My background with compilers helped me understand AngularJS, AngularJS helped me fall in love with JavaScript.

cards.heading: Angular
description: I published my first open source Angular Directive, the angular-bootstrap-datetimepicker, in 2013 and now it thousands of downloads per week.

cards.heading: React
description: In 2015, I two days to learn React and then live-code a new application in front of 30 students; It went great. I find React easy and intuitive IF you know JavaScript well.

cards.heading: Git
description: I have used Git version control since 2011 in open source projects, small teams, and Fortune 100 enterprise teams.

testimonials.text: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds, adored by little statesmen and philosophers and divines. With consistency a great soul has simply nothing to do.
testimonials.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Self-Reliance

testimonials.text: When the facts change, I alter my conclusions. What do you do?
testimonials.author: John Maynard Keynes

testimonials.text: If we have data, let’s look at data. If all we have are opinions, let’s go with mine.
testimonials.author: Jim Barksdale

intro: Most of my projects are confidential, but I will share what I can here.

cards.heading: Angular bootstrap date & time picker
description: Native Angular date/time picker component styled by Twitter Bootstrap and powered by moment.

When I published this as an open source Angular project, I thought a few people might use it, maybe 20 if I was lucy. Imagine my surprise as the downloads grew! At last count there were nearly 1000 downloads per day.

cards.heading: Prize-O-Tron
description: Simple Angular application to award prizes at Meetup events.
During my first instructor assignment I discovered that I needed a way to generate random-exhaustive pair programming assignments for the class. Teachers Pet was the result.

cards.heading: Teachers Pet
description: Simple Angular application to help with classroom instruction.
During my first instructor assignment I discovered that I needed a way to generate random-exhaustive pair programming assignments for the class. Teachers Pet was the result.

intro: Think I'd be a good fit for your team?
I'd love to hear from you, give me a shout by using the form below if you'd like to get in contact with me.
